Class Playlist

java.lang.Object
Playlist
public class Playlist
extends java.lang.Object
The Playlist class uses and ArrayList to encapsulate however much of Songs we have.
Version:
0.1
Author:
Rebekah Lee

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Playlist()
    Initialize the songs field.
    Playlist​(java.lang.String filename)
    Create a Playlist by parsing a text file of info Strings.

  • Method Summary

    • Playlist

      public Playlist​(java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Create a Playlist by parsing a text file of info Strings.
      Parameters:
      filename - the filename holds the info of the String.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if a file is not found, throw an exception.

  • Method Details

    • getNumSongs

      public int getNumSongs()
      Create a method to get the number of songs.
      Returns:
      returns number of songs.

    • getSong

      public Song getSong​(int index)
      Get song from the index. If index is less than 0 or greater than or equals to getNumSongs, return null.
      Parameters:
      index - given index.
      Returns:
      returns song from that index.

    • getSongs

      public Song[] getSongs()
      Get song array at 0.
      Returns:
      a song array.

    • addSong

      public boolean addSong​(Song song)
      This method checks if the song is added or not.
      Parameters:
      song - given song from Song class.
      Returns:
      true when a song is added.

    • addSong

      public boolean addSong​(int index, Song song)
      Add Song to the Playlist at the given index if only if the Song is not null or index is not out of bounds.
      Parameters:
      index - given index.
      song - gjven song.
      Returns:
      true if add song.

    • addSongs

      public int addSongs​(Playlist playlist)
      Add the given Songs to the end of the Playlist in the given order.
      Parameters:
      playlist - given playlist.
      Returns:
      number of added Songs.

    • addSongs

      public int addSongs​(java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      Read a file of info Strings with the given name. For each line of the file, create a Song and add it to the end of the Playlist.
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file.
      Returns:
      the number of counts.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if file not found, throw an exception.

    • removeSong

      public Song removeSong()
      Remove and return the last Song in the array.
      Returns:
      Song to be removed.

    • removeSong

      public Song removeSong​(int index)
      Remove and return the Song of the given index.
      Parameters:
      index - given index.
      Returns:
      null if index out of bounds. Else, return Song.

    • saveSongs

      public void saveSongs​(java.lang.String filename) throws java.io.IOException
      Save the output of toString to a file with the given name. Overwrite the contents of the file if it already exists.
      Parameters:
      filename - given file name.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if there is an input/output exception.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      Use toString method to join sentences by using line separators.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      Returns the String representations of the Songs joined by line separators.

    • getTotalTime

      public int[] getTotalTime()
      Return the total time of all the Songs as an array of integers. Use the same format as the time field in the Song class.
      Returns:
      an int array of total time.
